dfischer.utils

Class XmlContentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.XmlContentParser

  • public class XmlContentParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses a XML document. After that, the value of one or several nodes or node-attributes can be extracted and/or modified. If modifications of the XML document have been made, the method getXMLAsText() can be called to get a new (updated) XML document.

    • Constructor Summary

      Parses the XML content of a HTTP response.

      Parses a XML document.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlContentParser

        public XmlContentParser(java.lang.String xmlDocument,
                LogVector logVector)
        Parses a XML document.
        Parameters:
        xmlDocument - the XML document (input data)
        logVector - log vector to which parsing exceptions or errors are written. This parameter can also be null - in such case exceptions or errors are written to stdout or stderr

      • XmlContentParser

        public XmlContentParser(HttpTestURL httpTestURL,
                LogVector logVector)
        Parses the XML content of a HTTP response.
        Parameters:
        httpTestURL - reference to a successful executed URL call (input data)
        logVector - log vector to which parsing exceptions or errors are written. This parameter can also be null - in such case exceptions or errors are written to stdout or stderr

    • Method Detail

      • getNodeValue

        public java.lang.String getNodeValue(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                            int occurrenceCount)
        Extracts the value of a node.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        Returns:
        the value of the node, or null if the node was not found

      • getNodeValueToken

        public java.lang.String getNodeValueToken(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                                 int occurrenceCount,
                                 int tokenNr,
                                 java.lang.String tokenDelimiterChars,
                                 boolean trim)
        Extracts the value of a node token.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        tokenNr - token number whose text will be extracted. The first token has the number 1
        tokenDelimiterChars - delimiters for separating tokens. Delimiter characters themselves will not be treated as tokens.
        trim - if true, trim leading and ending white spaces of the result
        Returns:
        the value of the node token, or null if the node was not found - or null if the token number is greater than the max. number of all tokens

      • findNodeValue

        public java.lang.String findNodeValue(java.lang.String searchXmlPath,
                             java.lang.String searchNodeValue,
                             java.lang.String extractXmlPath)
        Extracts the value of a node depending on the value of another node. This method searches first for a node which has a specific path and value. After that node has found the search is continued until a second xml path is found. Then the node value is extracted from this second xml path.
        Parameters:
        searchXmlPath - xml path of the first node
        searchNodeValue - value of the first node
        extractXmlPath - xml path of the second node
        Returns:
        value of the second node, or null if nothing is found

      • findNodeValueByAttributePath

        public java.lang.String findNodeValueByAttributePath(java.lang.String searchXmlPath,
                                            java.lang.String attributeName,
                                            java.lang.String attributeValue,
                                            java.lang.String extractXmlPath)
        Extracts the value of a node depending on the name and value of an attribute of another node. This method searches first for a node which has a specific path and contains an attribute with a specific name and value. After that node has found the search is continued until a second xml path is found. Then the node value is extracted from this second xml path.
        Parameters:
        searchXmlPath - xml path of the first node
        attributeName - name of the attribute in the first node
        attributeValue - value of the attribute in the first node
        extractXmlPath - xml path of the second node
        Returns:
        value of the second node, or null if nothing is found

      • setNodeValue

        public void setNodeValue(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                int occurrenceCount,
                java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of a node.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        value - the new value of the node

      • setNodeValuePattern

        public void setNodeValuePattern(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                       int occurrenceCount,
                       java.lang.String replaceText,
                       int replaceOccurrencePosition,
                       java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of a node pattern.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        replaceText - pattern to replace within the value of the node
        replaceOccurrencePosition - position of pattern within the value of the node, 0 = all positions, 1 = first position, 2 = second position ...
        value - new value which replaces the pattern

      • getAttributeValue

        public java.lang.String getAttributeValue(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                                 int occurrenceCount,
                                 java.lang.String attributeName)
        Extracts the value of an attribute within an node.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        attributeName - the name of the attribute. Example: "xmlns:D"
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute, or null if the node - or the attribute within the node - was not found

      • getAttributeValueToken

        public java.lang.String getAttributeValueToken(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                                      int occurrenceCount,
                                      java.lang.String attributeName,
                                      int tokenNr,
                                      java.lang.String tokenDelimiterChars,
                                      boolean trim)
        Extracts the value of an attribute token within an node.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        attributeName - the name of the attribute. Example: "xmlns:D"
        tokenNr - token number whose text will be extracted. The first token has the number 1
        tokenDelimiterChars - delimiters for separating tokens. Delimiter characters themselves will not be treated as tokens.
        trim - if true, trim leading and ending white spaces of the result
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute token, or null if the node - or the attribute within the node - was not found - or null if the token number is greater than the max. number of all tokens

      • setAttributeValue

        public void setAttributeValue(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                     int occurrenceCount,
                     java.lang.String attributeName,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of an attribute within an node.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        attributeName - the name of the attribute. Example: "xmlns:D"
        value - the new value of the attribute

      • setAttributeValuePattern

        public void setAttributeValuePattern(java.lang.String xmlPath,
                            int occurrenceCount,
                            java.lang.String attributeName,
                            java.lang.String replaceText,
                            int replaceOccurrencePosition,
                            java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value of an attribute pattern within an node.
        Parameters:
        xmlPath - the path to the node. Example: "<D:prop><D:lockdiscovery><D:activelock><D:locktoken><D:href>"
        occurrenceCount - the occurrence count (1, 2 ..) of the path within the XML document
        attributeName - the name of the attribute. Example: "xmlns:D"
        replaceText - pattern to replace within the value of the attribute
        replaceOccurrencePosition - position of pattern within the value of the attribute, 0 = all positions, 1 = first position, 2 = second position ...
        value - new value which replaces the pattern

      • findValue

        public XmlContentParserItem[] findValue(java.lang.String value)
        Search a value over all nodes and attributes.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to search
        Returns:
        An array of all nodes which contain the value in the node text or in an attribute value, or an empty array if nothing is found.

      • getAllValues

        public XmlContentParserItem[] getAllValues()
        Get all values over all nodes and attributes.
        Returns:
        An array of all nodes which contain a value in the node text or in an attribute value, or an empty array if nothing is found.

      • findItemsByXmlPathFragment

        public XmlContentParserItem[] findItemsByXmlPathFragment(java.lang.String xmlPathFragment)
        Search all nodes which match to a XML path fragment.
        Parameters:
        xmlPathFragment - XML path fragment
        Returns:
        list of all matched nodes, or an empty array if nothing is found.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Checks if the XML parser is initialized with data.
        Returns:
        true if the XML parser is initialized with data, else false

      • getXMLAsText

        public java.lang.String getXMLAsText()
        Returns the (modified) XML document as a text string.
        Returns:
        the XML document as a text string.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Internal test utility.
